intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris exotica, commonly known as the common chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring small, white or pinkish flowers and hairy, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, round, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, lawns, and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common weed but also a subject of interest in ecological and agricultural studies.
